column4: hello, I should export Proxy-configurations to connect from a proxy at work, I wrote some lines too in /etc/profile to do this. Now I removed the lines from /etc/profile but apt-get still use the proxy-configuration!! I want now just to desactive the proxy-configuration and go back to direct internet connection. can someone help please?
have you logged out and logged back in?
but in /etc/profile the proxy-configuration is deactived!
have you done what I asked?
you mean logged out an in back, yes
I asked you more than that
I copied what env about proxy says because the output of env is long!
I still want to see it all. and you haven't pasted an url
can I do this on a dialog window?
hmm sorry it's my first channelvisit, I dont understand what you mean :(
it takes a lot off time!!
somewhere in a file there is a HTTP_PROXY on yout siystem set. either in ~ or in /etc. if not: then you didn't really log out
and that would mean you lied to me. I want to think good things about people so I'd say you didn't lie. for now
if you want to help me so do that if not or you cant so pls stop say everything!
